content: Hey Cargonians! Can I get one more review on https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/pull/9663 ? It's in FCP, and Alex and ehuss have signed off.
Ah, my mistake, it was "proposed fcp" and now thanks to Eh2406 it's in actual fcp; sorry about that! First contribution to Rust :)
We are a small team, so we don't all ways follow the formal prosses to the letter. Just to make it more confusing :-P
For the record, this entire process has been extremely pleasant and more than brisk enough from my perspective, which I appreciate given the small team size :)

hey rust-pals :) This feels extremely silly, but I added a line to the RELEASES.md to announce this change to cargo, but it renders as plain text on https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/RELEASES.md . I have tried the following, to no avail:

  • making the line shorter, like the other longer lines
  • removing quotes
  • removing curly braces
  • removing backticks
  • removing all non letters-or-spaces

nothing fills in the link to the cargo pr like the other lines when viewed on github-dot-com; am I missing a step?
You need to add [cargo/9663]: https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/pull/9663 on a separate line. This tells where the link actually points to.

Joe Ardent said:

hey rust-pals :) This feels extremely silly [...]

in the end, it was at least a little silly of me :)
